intro: Prestonia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and is often found in secondary forests. The flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant produces berries that contain seeds.
